reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think most of the reviews on here sum up our holiday experience pretty well. We booked the holiday through First Choice and travelled in the premier class. This was good as we had priority boarding and check in, although considering the extra money paid the seats were not that comfortable and seemed to be distinctly lacking in cushioning under the behind! Also myself and another person (not in my party) on the flight back were unwell at around the same time (just before landing), so I am inclined to think this was brought on by the in-flight food.
reviews.title: Overall would recommend

reviews.text: As for the Dunes, I would reiterate what other people have said. It's not the Ritz, however the facilities are good and the staff are very friendly and helpful (which we found to be representative of Venezuela as a whole). We had a room on the 2nd floor near the front gate which we were happy with as it was nice and quiet and gave us a bit of exercise walking to the main building, although the trolley car was never very far away if needed. We had a problem with our television when we arrived and it was promptly repaired. The rooms were basic but clean and the air conditioning worked without problem.
reviews.title: Great for the price paid

likes.disliked: — Lack of a variety of restuarants

reviews.title: Loved the Dunes beach resort
reviews.text: The food was fine, it took a little bit of getting used to some of the dishes but we had no problems with illness or finding food we liked.

As recommended we booked our trips with Marcos Ochoa of Marcos Tours. Marcos was great and so were his tours. We took the round the island trip, the 2 day Canaima/Delta tour and we also went on a fishing trip that he arranged. We have nothing but positive things to say about Marcos and would recommend him to anyone. He picked us up and dropped us off to get to our trips and was always very prompt. The Canaima/Delta tour was brilliant. We spent a day on the Orinoco staying in a lodge on the river and then went on to the Canaima National Park. Unfortunately we didn't get to see Angel Falls as the weather was too bad but the rest of the trip was so amazing that we weren't really all that disappointed. My only advice is that the passenger planes are a bit scary if you're not fond of flying!
reviews.title: Thank you Dunes Hotel and Marcos Tours

likes.liked: — We felt relaxed and at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned by others the sea is quite rough but its actually good fun dodging the waves, and as long as you're careful then there is no reason not to go in. Once you are past the break then the water is lovely - clear and no seaweed!
reviews.title: Great holiday, but hotel needs to make changes

reviews.text: we stayed from 21st july escaping the flooding and problems at home. The airport is basic and the baggage claim was slow. the hotel was great although food basic. We did ask to have a room switch as we were put up by themain gate a distance from the main area, our new rooms were fine, although there was noise from a group or english youths who were in a different block from their parents. This was soon sorted thanks to the services of First Choice's "Taxi Pete ", The pools were great, beach was great and quiet, evening entertainment very good. The all inclusive package offered By First Choice is not beatable.Time Share customers spoken to from UK had paid more for a flight alone, than we did each for a package. The staff here were very friendly and Elvis in the lobby bar excelled in his job. The excursion prices were a lot lower than I expected and used First choice for the trips all were good, costing about the same as marcos .The grounds were kept to a high standard at all times. This was the first holiday in years I can truly i say came home relaxed
reviews.title: Dunes lovely place
OK. Prepare for the "all inclusive" package!
reviews.text: We traded our timeshare through Interval Int. Not bad. But we were not prepared for the "all inclusive" meal package. For about $55- US you can buy a daily all inclusive meal package allowing you to eat at the resort's many restaurants. The food is adequate, but you really don't have any nearby options except for the small Zaragoza beach cafes to the South West. The kitchens are minimal for those who cook and there are limited groceries at the resort anyway. No need to pay the $40- van to Polimar. Just use a taxi if you have less than 3 people and you will be more flexible and save $$s. For those who just stay on a resort and don't explore the nearby towns, the Dunes would be ok. But we just like to explore on our vacations and ended up renting a car for $70- US a day. I also suggest a taxi ride into nearby Juangriego for lunch or dinner. Small town, but more quiet when compared to Polimar.

We stayed at The Dunes Hotel and Resort in January for 8 days. It was our first visit there. They have the option of all-inclusive but you don't have to. I would recommend it though. They have the usual buffet area for breakfast lunch & dinner or they have restaurants you can make reservations at to eat as well. We opted for the all inclusive which included all alcoholic beverages. The food wasn't bad at all.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Fun

likes.liked: — large expansive grounds that the hotel is on. great beach, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented a car (from the resort) and drove around the island for one day. It was beautiful. There were sections of almost desert like scenes with cactus. The one side of the island has cliffs and a lighthouse and crashing waves, which the Dunes Hotel is near. The opposite side of the island the water is more calm.
reviews.title: our time at the dunes.

reviews.text: The Dunes Hotel has a great beach. You can lay under the palm huts or out on the sand. They have plenty of beach chairs. Plus a walk down the beach is so pretty. You can also take a walking tour up the cliff to the lighthouse right from the resort. They also have bicycles, several pools plus a separate pool area for children, pool activities, a massage therapist, pool tables, beach volley ball, shows at night, stuff like that. They have a lot of things to do at the resort so you wouldn't have to leave if you didn't feel like it.
reviews.title: Fantastic Time!!!

likes.liked: — It was clean and well air conditioned
likes.disliked: — I had a leak in my window, but it wasn't anything major

reviews.text: Travelled premier class and was only disapointed by the reduced luggage allowance. It is now only 23 kg. After a good and comfortable flight we arrived to torrential rain and thunderstorms. Immigration was slow but steady as passports appeared to be scanned into a computer. Premier class got their luggage and were met by the rep, water was coming through the airport ceiling and the electricity went out. A generator soon came on and whilst we waited for the rest of the luggage we were provided with soft drinks. It took about 40 mins to arrive at the hotel where we were offered a soft drink and sandwiches. Check in was quick and we were shown to our rooms. We were given a room in block 35 by the gate, there is a shuttle bus which runs constantly, but it takes less than 5 mins to walk and was a good place to be.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday

reviews.text: Our room was a good size and basic but had everything we needed, except for a couple of extra blankets. the air con was freezing. Sheets and towels changed daily and a bottle of water left in your room. The security guard at the entrance was friendly and ferried us back and forth under umbrellas when it rained, mainly in the evening.
reviews.title: Could have been better!

reviews.text: At the back of the block there is building work going on, but was not a problem. The capybaras are now behind the fencing, however it is still possible to feed them and they appear to visit the gate area everyday between 5 and 6.
reviews.title: Our best vacation yet! Don't hesitate to go ther!

reviews.text: Pool areas clean and beds always available, there is always something going on if you wish to participate. The entertainment team work hard and aim to please. A few words of Spanish are greatly appreciated. The pool is like a warm bath by the afternoon. The sea was great and was yelow flagged everyday except for one, when waves were crashing. We enjoyed the waves although they were mostly gentle, my daughter and her friend spent days in the sea.
reviews.title: Little known jewel of the carrabian

reviews.text: We both burnt on the first day with a factor 40. i usually use 30 the first week and 20 the second and have never burnt before, so please beware. A hat is useful in the water, i burnt my head and spent the second week with a peelinganditchy scalp.
reviews.title: Amazing holiday

reviews.text: This is a great place to stay if you're looking to truly get away from it all and just kick back and relax. The resort is set in a peaceful area with a beautiful beach and palm trees everywhere. There are 3 pools for kids, relaxation and activities and all are constantly being cleaned and well maintained. Tons of sun loungers so you don't feel crowded or a bit too up close and personal with your fellow guests, unless of course you want to be in which case you can easily join them at the bars or restaurants as well!
reviews.title: Loved the locals and friendly laid back atmosphere

likes.liked: — The staff - nothing is too much trouble and they are great fun

reviews.text: Rooms are pretty standard and prob more 3 than 4 star, but it's unlikely you'll care given your beautiful surroundings and the fact that you would be hard pushed to find friendlier and more helpful staff anywhere in the world. Venezuelans are great fun and love to dance, chat and smile. They will make you feel very welcome and very sad to leave!
reviews.title: Hotel as good as last year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food is all fine and no upset tummies whilst we were there. At the risk of sounding like your mother, do be VERY careful with the sun though, I thought they were joking when they said Factor 40 plus was the best, they weren't and you could tell by the very red people around the pool who had chosen to ignore their advice!! The sun even burns through t-shirts and swim wear so unless you want red raw bits rather than white bits, you have been warned ;0) !!
reviews.title: Loved the laid-back culture

likes.liked: — It was quiet, relaxing with nice surroundings.

reviews.text: Trip to Angel falls and around the islands were great and well worth booking but sure you will find plenty of things to keep you entertained, something for everyone really.
reviews.title: Good Service
dunes hotel
reviews.text: Loved this place and would happily recommend to anyone.
